result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas George Slock Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay a FINE in the amount of $600.00, plus all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharge to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Concurrent with: concurrent to Count 2, and any other sentence, credit for 72 DAYS time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with firearms.
Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

No VIOLENT contact with Todd W. or Wendy G.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

Batterers Intervention program, or a course in anger management based on evaluation.
Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
Provide a DNA sample.

supervisions.notes: Court further ordered an ignition interlock device be fitted on each vehicle registered to the defendant for a period of 24 MONTHS after driver's license has been reinstated.
Court ordered defendant complete an IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.

Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV  surcharges to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision on Count 1, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Concurrent with: concurrent to Count 1, and any other sentence, credit for 72 DAYS time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Douglas George Slock Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original EXCERPT OF SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (7 pages) commencing 05/28/15 received and filed.

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Additional Statements by Todd. W.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 YEARS, concurrent to Count 2, and any other sentence, credit for 72 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR. Pay a FINE in the amount of $600.00, plus all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharge to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. Court ordered defendant's driver's license revoked for 36 MONTHS. Court further ordered an ignition interlock device be fitted on each vehicle registered to the defendant for a period of 24 MONTHS after driver's license has been reinstated. Court ordered defendant complete an IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term confinement of 75 DAYS, concurrent to Count 1, and any other sentence, credit for 72 DAYS time served. Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV  surcharges to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision on Count 1, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Batterers Intervention program, or a course in anger management based on evaluation.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-No VIOLENT contact with Todd W. or Wendy G.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV (as to count 2) surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court finds defendant IS eligible for BOTH the Challenge Incarceration Program AND the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.

Defendant Douglas George Slock in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Douglas George Slock in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations on a motion of the state, the court ordered Count 2 AMENDED to remove the Repeater enhancer (939.62(1)(a)).
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2 AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

ADA advised the court that Todd W. was previously in court and requests a No Violent Contact Order. ADA further advised the court that Wendy G. requested a no violent contact order as to the minor children. State and Defense Counsel do NOT object. Court Granted a no violent contact order as to Todd W., and the minor children of Wendy G. No contact order remains with Wendy G.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Douglas George Slock not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea & Sentencing. Case adjourned for Plea & Sentencing to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.     No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Wendy G or her children; Todd W.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. 
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. 
Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. 
Original Information, received and filed. 
Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. 
Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.

Defendant Douglas George Slock in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  
Defendant Douglas George Slock in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Defendant pleads Not Guilty as to Misdemeanor Count.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
